meanings.definition: Past tense of prefroze: to freeze beforehand.
meanings.sent1: I prefroze the berries before making the smoothie.
meanings.sent2: She always prefroze the cookie dough for later use.
meanings.sent3: The chef prefroze the soup, but it ended up tasting like ice cream!
meanings.sent4: His fear prefroze him in place, unable to move.
meanings.sent5: The cold weather prefroze the lake, turning it into a solid sheet of ice.

meanings.sent1: The prefroze meat was ready to be cooked quickly.
meanings.sent2: We enjoyed the prefroze popsicles on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent3: The prefroze ice cream was so hard, it broke the spoon!
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt prefroze with anticipation before the big announcement.
meanings.sent5: The prefroze vegetables retained their freshness for a long time.

meanings.definition: Prefroze (noun): a state of being frozen before use.
meanings.sent1: The prefroze of the lake made it safe for ice skating.
meanings.sent2: The chef stored the dessert in the prefroze to keep it fresh.
meanings.sent3: The prefroze of the juice made it impossible to pour.
meanings.sent4: His mind was in a prefroze, unable to come up with a solution.
meanings.sent5: The prefroze of the meat preserved its quality until cooking time.
